metadata.titleEn: Geochemical data set of adakitic rocks in western Liaoning
metadata.description: This data set mainly includes whole rock major and trace geochemical data and whole rock SR Nd isotopic data of adakitic rocks in western Liaoning Province. The main element geochemical data of the whole rock were obtained by XRF analysis, the trace element geochemical data were obtained by ICP-MS analysis, and the whole rock Sr-Nd isotopic data were obtained by TIMS test. All the above data have been published in the international authoritative geoscience Journal Lithos, and the data are true, effective, complete and reliable. Through the analysis and Simulation of this set of data, we can establish the genetic model of continental adakitic rocks and constrain the tectonic background model of their formation.
metadata.instructions: The data is stored in Excel file format, which can be directly opened using Excel file book. The whole rock major and trace element geochemical data is named "2017 WR data", and the whole rock SR Nd isotopic data is named "Sr-Nd isotope data".

literatureList.titleEn: Generation of continental adakitic rocks: Crystallization modeling with variable bulk partition coefficients
literatureList.referenceEn: Dai, H.K., Zheng, J.P., Zhou, X., & Griffin, W.L. (2017). Generation of continental adakitic rocks: Crystallization modeling with variable bulk partition coefficients. Lithos, 272–273, 222–231.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the main features and characteristics of geochemical data collected from adakitic rocks?
Feature Specification.Answer: whole-rock major and trace element data, whole-rock Sr-Nd isotopic data

Quantification.Question: How many types of geochemical analysis methods were used to collect data on adakitic rocks in western Liaoning?

Definition.Question: What are '全岩主微量地球化学数据' and how are they obtained in geochemical studies?
Definition.Answer: 全岩主微量地球化学数据 refer to the major and trace element geochemical data of whole rock samples. In geochemical studies, major element data are typically obtained using X-ray fluorescence (XRF) analysis, while trace element data are gathered using Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (ICP-MS).

Comparison.Question: How do the data collection methods of XRF for major element geochemistry compare to ICP-MS for trace element analysis in terms of sensitivity and precision in geochemical datasets of adakite rocks?
Comparison.Answer: XRF is utilized for major element geochemistry due to its ability to provide precise and accurate measurements for larger concentrations in whole rock samples, whereas ICP-MS is employed for trace element analysis because of its high sensitivity and precision in detecting low concentration elements. Both methods together provide a comprehensive dataset for understanding the geochemistry of adakite rocks in western Liaoning.

Interpretation.Question: How can the integration of XRF, ICP-MS, and TIMS techniques enhance the accuracy and reliability of geochemical data collection for adakitic rocks?
Interpretation.Answer: The integration of XRF, ICP-MS, and TIMS techniques allows for comprehensive data collection across major, trace, and isotopic elements. XRF provides robust analysis of major elements, ICP-MS offers precise measurements of trace elements, and TIMS delivers accurate isotopic data. This combination ensures a thorough understanding of the geochemical composition, leading to more accurate modeling of the formation and tectonic background of adakitic rocks.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the implications for geochemical modeling accuracy when using data collected through XRF, ICP-MS, and TIMS methods for analyzing adakitic rocks in a specific region?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using data collected through XRF for major elements, ICP-MS for trace elements, and TIMS for Sr-Nd isotopes ensures comprehensive and reliable datasets for geochemical modeling of adakitic rocks. The accuracy of these methods allows for precise elemental and isotopic analysis, which is crucial in developing a robust genetic model and constraining the tectonic background of continental adakitic rocks.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the purpose of collecting geochemical and isotopic data on adakite-like rocks in the western region of Liaoning, and how does this contribute to understanding their formation and tectonic setting?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The purpose of collecting geochemical and isotopic data on adakite-like rocks in the western region of Liaoning is to establish a genesis model for continental adakite rocks and to constrain the tectonic setting in which they formed. This is achieved through analysis and simulation of the dataset, which includes whole-rock major and trace geochemical data, as well as whole-rock Sr-Nd isotopic data obtained through XRF, ICP-MS, and TIMS testing. The dataset has been validated and published in a reputable geological journal, ensuring its reliability and completeness.
